channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

X-2024010248 SequenceEvent: Dropped hazmat caused a punctured whole in the metal can which caused the hazmat to leak DescribePack: Dropping a hazmat is dangerous in the case the pail was punctured DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Dropped hazmat caused the liquid to release. 2. X-2024010249 SequenceEvent: DAMAGED DURING UNLOADING, FELL OFF THE BELT DescribePack: LID/PUNCTURED WHICH CAUSED INTERNAL LEAKAGE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: APPLIED SPILL FIX TO SECURE THE SAFETY OF OTHERS.

item.title: Report E-2024010141
item.description:
Report E-2024010141

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-11
  • City: SALISBURY
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The trailer was fine until it arrived to offload. Once they started offloading the trailer began dripping 2 drips every 5 seconds. They were able to contain the leak to a bucket and finished the offload so it could be sent for repairs. We're a bit surprised it started leaking at the time it did. Usually when doing a pump offload it creates a 'vacuum' away from the source of the leak and slows it down. In this case this is when it started leaking. I likely has to do with when the internal valve was opened though that allowed it to get to the sump gasket. That is what actually leaked.
